mainBoard.name: Balduvian Horde

rulings.text: You choose whether to discard or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice this card. You can choose to not discard even if you no longer control this card on resolution.

mainBoard.text: When Balduvian Horde enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random.

mainBoard.name: Ball Lightning

rulings.text: The creature is sacrificed at the end of every turn in which it is on the battlefield. There is no choice about what turn to sacrifice it.

mainBoard.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ball Lightning.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"He's big an' dumb an' ready to fight. A lot like ol' Hornhead here."
—Squee, goblin cabin hand, scouting report
mainBoard.name: Bloodrock Cyclops

rulings.text: There is no penalty if it can’t attack.

mainBoard.text: Bloodrock Cyclops attacks each combat if able.

mainBoard.name: Clockwork Beast

rulings.text: Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
This is a change from the most recent wording. Now, if some other spell or ability causes +1/+0 counters to be put on Clockwork Beast, it can wind up with more than seven such counters on it.

If Clockwork Beast has seven or fewer +1/+0 counters on it when its last ability resolves, it can wind up a maximum of seven such counters on it. If it has seven or more +1/+0 counters on it, the ability will have no effect.
Clockwork Beast’s last ability resolves, you can choose to put fewer than X +1/+0 counters on it.

mainBoard.text:
Clockwork Beast enters the battlefield with seven +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Beast attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast to be greater than seven. Activate only during your upkeep.

mainBoard.flavorText: Bores ruin a party. Boars are party to ruin.
mainBoard.name: Crashing Boars

rulings.text: If the chosen creature is not still untapped at the time blockers are declared, it does not have to block.
The ability is not optional. If there are no untapped creatures to choose, then the ability does nothing.

mainBoard.text: Whenever Crashing Boars attacks, defending player chooses an untapped creature they control. That creature blocks Crashing Boars this turn if able.

mainBoard.flavorText:
Love is like a rhino, short-sighted and hasty; if it cannot find a way, it will make a way.
—Femeref adage
mainBoard.name: Crash of Rhinos
mainBoard.text: Trample

mainBoard.flavorText: With his newfound sense of self-importance, Squee set his sights on ever-bigger bugs.
mainBoard.name: Deadly Insect
mainBoard.text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

mainBoard.name: Erhnam Djinn

rulings.text: In multiplayer games you can choose a different player’s creature each upkeep. You are forced to pick a creature that some opponent controls if there is at least one creature on the battlefield that is a legal target.
If you have more than one Djinn, you can have all of them target the same creature with their ability.
If there are no creatures your opponent controls to target at the beginning of your upkeep, ignore this ability.

mainBoard.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target non-Wall creature an opponent controls gains forestwalk until your next upkeep. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

mainBoard.name: Force of Nature
mainBoard.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.

mainBoard.flavorText: Anyone can get around a cyclops, but few can stand in its way.
mainBoard.name: Hulking Cyclops
mainBoard.text: Hulking Cyclops can't block.

mainBoard.name: Kird Ape
mainBoard.text: Kird Ape gets +1/+2 as long as you control a Forest.

mainBoard.flavorText:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing
mainBoard.name: Llanowar Elves
mainBoard.text: {T}: Add {G}.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Faugh!" snorted Tahngarth. "Why would it make a meal of something like you?" Squee looked relieved. "No," he continued, "you'd make a much better toothpick."
mainBoard.name: Lowland Giant

mainBoard.flavorText: Most spiders wait patiently for their prey to arrive. Most spiders aren't forty feet tall.
mainBoard.name: Plated Spider

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

mainBoard.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

mainBoard.name: Quirion Elves
mainBoard.text:
As Quirion Elves enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{T}: Add {G}.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color.

mainBoard.flavorText: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.
mainBoard.name: Raging Goblin
mainBoard.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Flourishing during the Ice Age, these wurms were the bane of all Kjeldorans. Their great size and ferocity made them the subject of countless nightmares—they embodied the worst of the Ice Age."
—*Kjeldor: Ice Civilization*
mainBoard.name: Scaled Wurm

mainBoard.flavorText:
"If only we could so easily leave behind those parts of ourselves that pain us."
—Crovax
mainBoard.name: Segmented Wurm
mainBoard.text: Whenever Segmented Wurm becomes the target of a spell or ability, put a -1/-1 counter on it.

mainBoard.flavorText: Freyalise forbid that any stranger should wander into the striders' territory.
mainBoard.name: Shambling Strider
mainBoard.text: {R}{G}: Shambling Strider gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

mainBoard.name: Shivan Dragon
mainBoard.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText:
Don't insult a Talruum unless your mount is swift.
—Suq'Ata saying
mainBoard.name: Talruum Minotaur
mainBoard.text: Haste

mainBoard.flavorText: The giant was felt a few seconds before he was seen.
mainBoard.name: Thundering Giant
mainBoard.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

mainBoard.flavorText:
"When traveling the Great Desert avoid wearing the scales of lizards, for the Viashino rule the sands and look poorly on the skinning of their cousins."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert
mainBoard.name: Viashino Warrior

mainBoard.flavorText:
"We need not fear the forces of the air; I've yet to see a spider without an appetite."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter
mainBoard.name: Woolly Spider
mainBoard.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever Woolly Spider blocks a creature with flying, Woolly Spider gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: When the gorilla playfully grabbed the wurm's tail, the wurm doubled back and playfully ate the gorilla's head.
mainBoard.name: Yavimaya Wurm
mainBoard.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)

mainBoard.name: Fireball

rulings.text: For example, if X is 5 and you choose three target creatures, Fireball has a total cost of {7}{R} (even though its mana cost is just {5}{R} and its converted mana cost is 6). If those creatures are all still legal targets as Fireball resolves, it deals 1 damage to each of them.
You may cast Fireball with zero targets, regardless of the value chosen for X. If you do so, it will not be a targeted spell, and no damage will actually be dealt when it resolves.
Fireball’s damage is divided as Fireball resolves, not as it’s cast, because there are no choices involved. The division involves only targets that are still legal as Fireball resolves.
You can target more than X creatures. However, if the number of legal targets at the time Fireball resolves is greater than X, none of them will be dealt any damage.

mainBoard.text:
This spell costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of targets.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Catch!"
mainBoard.name: Lava Axe
mainBoard.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.

mainBoard.flavorText: Rath forces plants from its surface as one presses whey from cheese.
mainBoard.name: Rampant Growth

rulings.text: The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

mainBoard.text: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.

mainBoard.name: Fog
mainBoard.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

mainBoard.name: Giant Growth
mainBoard.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

—Kor saying

rulings.text: You can’t discard more than once to target more than one creature (or player) or to do multiple amounts of damage to a single creature (or player).
You pick the target before you know which card is going to be discarded.

mainBoard.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card at random.
Sonic Burst deals 4 damage to any target.
